New Records: Dejounte Murray recorded a triple-double with 14 points, 10 rebounds, and 12 assists
New Orleans Pelicans made 18 three-pointers, setting a season high
Key Match Events: New Orleans Pelicans' defense significantly improved, limiting Washington to 98 points after a 68-45 first-half deficit
Yves Missi showcased strong defensive plays with key blocks and dunks
Dejounte Murray's triple-double was a pivotal moment in the game
Pre-Game Insights: CJ McCollum emphasized his aggressive play and efficiency in helping the team win
New Orleans Pelicans focused on perimeter defense and three-point shooting as a key strategy
Post-Match Reflections: The Pelicans' improved three-point shooting and defensive effort were highlighted as crucial factors for the win
CJ McCollum's consistent performance was praised by the coaching staff
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trey Murphy III's 22 points in the first three quarters before an injury
Herb Jones' active defense was noted for its impact on the game
Others: The game marked the Pelicans' second consecutive win, a positive momentum shift
